learning_objective: Use data to highlight or propose cause-and-effect relationships, predict outcomes, or communicate an idea.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex, an aspiring music producer, notices that the sound quality of their music improves when the recordings are done between midnight and 4 am. Alex conducts a mini-experiment over a period of 2 weeks, dividing it into different times of the day to record their music. The bar chart below indicates the number of times per week a satisfactory recording has been achieved. Based on the chart, which time interval should Alex choose to record music, to ensure the best sound quality?",
    "Answer1": "6 am - 12 pm",
    "Answer2": "12 pm - 6 pm",
    "Answer3": "6 pm - 12 am",
    "Answer4": "12 am - 6 am",
    "CorrectAnswer": "4",
    "Explanation": "The bar chart shows the highest number of satisfactory recordings were made between 12 am - 6 am. This suggests that during this time, the likelihood of getting a satisfactory sound quality is the highest."
}
